page.title: 04Housing
page.content: Most of the housing is in the form of farmhouses and most of them date from more than 100 years ago. They are largely built from local materials both stone and slate. There has been very little new housing as this is strictly controlled by the planning authority, The Lake District Special Planning Board. Many of the farms have new buildings for housing stock erected with grant aid from the E.E.C. and these are of steel clad construction. The only non-agricultural houses are a few converted farms for residential use, the Blacksmiths Arms pub (also a small farm), the church and an increasing number of holiday homes owned by 'offcomers' which are only inhabited for part of the year. One of these is the old water mill which still has its wheel, now inoperative.
